text: Hey everyone, welcome back, welcome to another exciting video and in this video, we are going to make our own video subtitle generator app using AI so basically what we are going to achieve in this video is if we have a video, let's say like you watch my videos and those videos are in Hindi language so what I want is that I have an AI tool to process my videos and generate subtitles in English language so that non-Hindi speakers can also watch my videos by reading subtitles so just to set the context first, if you have watched my live stream video yesterday then I have given you this challenge that if you can make this, it will be really cool so like this is a real problem that all the content creators face and I personally face and all the online tools like capwing, wheat are very expensive so I thought let's make our own and make a video or a tutorial that how I made this so let's start with the video before starting the video, let's take an overview of what we are going to do how we are going to approach this so basically what we are going to do is we are going to use docker so we have a docker container what we are going to do is we are going to use Ubuntu image in this we are going to install some tools in this so what we are going to do is we are going to install some video file in docker container and in return what we are going to do is we are going to make a text file a text file and an SRT file in which our transcriptions and I can say our subtitles will be there and it can be that whatever we are going to do in the video is in any language like Hindi, Punjabi or any language and in return what we are going to do is we are going to generate subtitles in English language so this is our approach and for this what we are going to do is we are going to use whisper AI so if you don't know what is whisper AI whisper AI is basically a large language model that works on videos or on audios and this is completely open source and free of cost so if you want to read its architecture then you can read it here so in this you can see that if the user says this then you can generate English transcriptions you can generate any to English transcriptions for example the user is talking in any language and the transcriptions that are being made are in English language and this is exactly what we want so let's start from the coding part I didn't want to waste much time here so we are going to use this and this is free of cost so for this video tutorial I have recorded a sample video here this is in Hindi language so let me show you the video so let me play it welcome so this is a sample video which is going to be in Hindi and we will try to generate subtitles of this Hindi video in English language so that our non-Hindi speaking audience can enjoy this video so let's see how our English subtitles come out so this is our video which we are going to translate so let's do one thing let's open our terminal this is our terminal and we will make a new project in the coding folder so we will call it video translator so this is our server video translator and in this I will do cd video translator and code dot which will open my vscode so as per our architecture we need to make a docker container so let's do one thing let's make a docker file and just in case you don't know docker you never worked with docker so what you can do is you can just head over to learn.pushkar.dev and you can just get at my course of docker I will put the link in the description so here is the course so in this we have covered the docker from absolute beginner to advanced level but please consider this course so you can see this course back to the topic so what we are going to do I will assume that you already know docker so what we are going to do is we will take a base image here first as I told you we will take a base image here what it means is that we will do it inside now we have to use this whisper ai it is very simple what we have to do is first we have to install the whisper ai so that is we have to install pip which is ok after that what we have to do is we have to install some tools here just like ffmpeg so internally we have to use ffmpeg and we have to install ffmpeg inside our docker container and we have to install this too after that that's it we are ready to go after that you can see what we have to do we have to say whisper whatever audio video file we have to give it will be in hindi language and we will say task translate so what it will do is translate it in english if we don't give this task then what it will do is the language in which we have this video will generate the same subtitles what we can do is we can make two translations we can make hindi subtitles and we can make english subtitles so this is going to be really cool so let's start it quickly so what we have to do is finally we want to do a command run that is apt update so our packages will be updated and after that what we are going to do is we are going to do apt install ffmpeg so what we have to do inside this docker container we have to install ffmpeg plus we have to install python so here you can quickly search like python install in ubuntu so how we can install python in ubuntu so let's see in documentation after apt update we just have to run this command and python will be installed we can say and and python 3 and similarly we will install pip install in ubuntu so we can see how we can install pip so we just have to write apt install this thing so here I can say and and this and make sure that we have a command of hyphen y or else it will ask us if we have to install it or not so as soon as we run this thing our packages are installed now what we have to do is we have to install visper ai inside our machine so I will do this command copy and we will do run and this so what will it do? it will install my open ai visper inside my docker container and after that we will run so we will say run and this that's it our visper ai setup is done now we will say entry point and here we will say bash if you run this container then it will run from bash ideally we should run visper but I want to show you how things work so here we can keep it bash now make sure that your docker demon is running so till this point my docker demon was still closed so I just run docker demon so you can see that my docker is running so docker is now running so now we just have to write a command then I will say build tag and we will say my visper okay we can name it and dot dot means the path where this docker file is and enter now this thing will take some time because it will first fetch ubuntu and then install all these things and then our container will be built which we can use for our translations so this thing is going to take a lot of time because ubuntu you can see that ubuntu is getting pulled if you already have ubuntu right if you already have ubuntu pulled then it will not take that much time but because this is my first time pulling this so it is taking time so it's okay we can wait so we wait on this cool so now you can see that our docker is set up if I come back then you will see that we have an image that is my visper so this is our custom image that we just made now we can use it here my desktop if I go to my terminal and I do a series dot dot so here if I
